lead_paragraph: Second baseman Freddy Sanchez, a two-time All-Star, signed a two-year, $11 million contract Tuesday with the Pittsburgh Pirates that included a 2010 option that could make the deal worth $18.4 million. Sanchez, 30, made $2.75 million last year and was seeking $4.9 million. The team offered $4.1 million.
